org.ensembl.datamodel
Interface Qtl

All Superinterfaces:
Persistent, java.io.Serializable
public interface Qtl
extends Persistent

Represents a quantitative trait locus (Qtl) in the EnsEMBL database. A Qtl is defined by two or three markers, two flanking and one optional peak marker. Its a region (or more often a group of regions) which is likely to affect the phenotype (trait) described in this Qtl. Each region is specified by a QtlFeature. If the Qtl can not be mapped to any regions in a the assembly then it has no QtlFeatures.

Author:
Craig Melsopp
See Also:
QtlFeature
